meanings.definition: The ball-shaped part of the eye within the socket.
meanings.sent1: My eyeball helps me see things clearly.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined my eyeball during the check-up.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally got soap in my eyeball while washing my face.
meanings.sent4: Her eyeball sparkled with excitement when she saw the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The eyeball is a delicate organ that needs to be protected.

meanings.definition: To look at closely or stare at intently.
meanings.sent1: I like to eyeball the details of a painting to appreciate the artistry.
meanings.sent2: She would often eyeball the menu before deciding what to order.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to eyeball the suspect's reaction to the question.
meanings.sent4: He could eyeball the finish line in the distance during the race.
meanings.sent5: Eyeballing the map, she tried to figure out the best route to take.
